text:
Hi everyone.
I would like information on how to implement a call by pressing the "Call" button.

I did not find any information on this in the documentation.
I will be very grateful for the hint
This should be a great place to start <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>
Hey everyone! Has anyone had any luck associating notes across ALL deals a contact is associated with via custom coded workflow action?

Error body:

```{"status":"error","message":"Couldn't validate some supplied token values: Event [id b00de34a-2aef-46e6-a911-425234ddeb84 | eventTypeId 1264797] does not contain property [feedback__message]. Must be one of [feedbackRating, feedbackMessage]","correlationId":"e6cef6c9-dae9-4adc-811b-24ad090af5d4","context":{"errorDetails":["Event [id b00de34a-2aef-46e6-a911-425234ddeb84 | eventTypeId 1264797] does not contain property [feedback__message]. Must be one of [feedbackRating, feedbackMessage]"]},"category":"VALIDATION_ERROR","subCategory":"TimelineEventErrors.INVALID_TOKENS_ERROR"}```

• Hi all, I was wondering if someone could help please? My clients developers are asking this: We need the details for the API (incl. authentication) and the interface contract.
• How we manage exception scenarios, if any?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Hello everyone!  I'm having problems with a Raw HTML version of a form that is embedded on a website. After submitting the form, it disappears and the Thank You Message does not display.

Check Form Submission Settings:
• Verify that the "Redirect to URL" option is not selected if you wish to display the Thank You Message on the same page.
Review HubSpot Form Settings:
• Ensure that there are no conflicting settings or validation rules that prevent the Thank You Message from displaying.
Or Clear Cache and Cookies
Thanks for the help.  Good stuff to check!  Oh... and especially... Clear Cache and Cookies.  Thank you!

HubSpot API returns appropriate status codes and error messages in case of failures. You should check the HTTP status code and parse the response body for error details. Implement error handling logic in your code to handle exceptions effectively.

To achieve this functionality, you would need to build a custom integration or use the HubSpot API to develop a solution that retrieves all deals associated with a contact and associates notes with each deal individually. This would involve coding and implementing the necessary logic to iterate through the contact's deals and create the desired note associations.

To implement a call functionality in HubSpot by pressing a "Call" button, follow these simplified steps:

1. Retrieve the contact's phone number from your data source.

2. Create a button or link element in your HubSpot email or web page.

3. Set the `href` attribute of the button or link to the phone number preceded by "tel:".

   Example: `<a href="tel:+1234567890">Call</a>`

4. When the "Call" button is clicked, it will trigger a call to the specified phone number using the default calling application on the user's device.

Please keep in mind that the behavior of the call functionality may depend on the user's device and settings.

To integrate HubSpot with a data connector, you'll typically need the following information:

1. Client ID: The Client ID is a unique identifier for your HubSpot app. To obtain the Client ID, you need to create an app in the HubSpot Developer Dashboard. If you haven't created an app yet, follow these steps:

   - Go to the HubSpot Developer Dashboard (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/apps>).
   - Click on "Create App" to start creating a new app.
   - Provide the necessary details for your app, such as the name, description, and other required information.
   - Once you've completed the app creation process, you should be able to find the Client ID in the app's settings.

2. Client Secret: The Client Secret is a confidential key used for secure authentication with HubSpot's OAuth 2.0. After creating your app in the HubSpot Developer Dashboard, you should be able to find the Client Secret in the app's settings, alongside the Client ID.

3. Refresh Token: The Refresh Token is used to obtain new access tokens when the current ones expire. To obtain a Refresh Token, you need to go through the OAuth 2.0 authorization process. This involves having the user authorize your app to access their HubSpot account. The authorization process will return a Refresh Token along with an initial Access Token. You can use the Refresh Token to obtain new Access Tokens as needed.

4. API Key (HAPIkey): The API Key, also known as the HAPIkey, is an authentication token used for API access. It's different from the OAuth 2.0 tokens mentioned above. To obtain an API Key, follow these steps:

   - Log in to your HubSpot account.
   - Navigate to "Settings" > "Integrations" > "API Key".
   - Click on "Create key" to generate a new API Key.

Once you have obtained the Client ID, Client Secret, Refresh Token, and API Key, you can use them in your data connector integration to authenticate and interact with the HubSpot API.

• Verify Bearer Token
• Check API Key Permissions
• Validate Endpoint
• Verify User Engagement
• Consider Rate Limiting

:question:
• Check Internet Connection
• Retry the Install URL
• Clear Browser Cache
• Try Different Browser or Device

If you have made any customizations to your blog templates or stylesheets, it's a good idea to save a copy of those customizations. In your HubSpot account, navigate to "Marketing" > "Website" > "Template Builder" to access your blog templates. Copy and save the template code or any custom CSS modifications you've made.

you can refer to the following HubSpot documentation:
• HubSpot Forms: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/create-a-form>
• HubSpot Workflows: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/create-a-new-workflow>
• Webhooks in HubSpot: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/integrations/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot>
• HubSpot API documentation: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>
